description:
Casino Ballroom
Hampton Beach, NH
7/18/91 

TAPER: John Redmond
SOURCE AKG 451s > D5 

AUD MCass (Maxell MX 90 min)> Sony TC-WE805S >
Art DI/O (48Khz, Input gain +~10dB, No "Tube Warmth")>
Delta DIO 2496> WaveLab v4.0c> WAV (@24/48)> FLAC (24-bit, v1.1.0)>
Mastering (see notes)> SHNv3

Transfer>24bit FLAC files by Weave - <a class="__cf_email__" href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" data-cfemail="ecbb898d9a89ac8a999e9884999e828998c2839e8b">[email&#160;protected]</a><script cf-hash='f9e31' type="text/javascript">

Mastering, and shorten done on REBA by Marmar- <a class="__cf_email__" href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" data-cfemail="2e47435a464b434f5c434f5c6e5d5a4057005c5c004d4143">[email&#160;protected]</a><script cf-hash='f9e31' type="text/javascript">

**Mastering**
24bit 48kHz FLAC > wav > Montage to reconstruct sets and add fades over flips > Internal 24bit rendering (no dither) > BBE @ 2/2/0 > Waves Rbass Module +3db @ 40Hz > Internal 24bit renerding (no dither) > Rendered 24/48 wav files > Waves L1+ (24bit, no dither, +4.3 gain make-up) > 48kHz>44.1/High and 24bit>16bit/Mode 1/Low via tc electronic Finalizer 96k > Tracking in Wavelab > SHNv3

- there are volume fades every so often throughout the show...those that could be fixed were.

Set 1:
01. Chalk Dust Torture
02. Foam
03. Runaway Jim
04. Guelah Papyrus
05. Suzy Greenberg
06. Stash
07. //Take the A-Train
08. Cavern
09. Mike's Song->
10. I Am Hydrogen->
11. Weekapaug Groove 

Set 2:
01. Llama
02. Reba
03. Poor Heart
04. Split Open and Melt
05. Lizards
06. The Landlady
07. //I Didn't Know
08. Possum 
Encore: 
09. Alumni Blues 

*Notes*
Shockra opened. With The Giant Country Horns.

The bouncers/security at The Casino Ballroom are assholes. The worst I have ever seen. The taper and I (weave) were on the guest list for this show. The bouncers at the door insisted we were not on the list. We had to find someone with a ticket to go inside and find John Paluska. Eventually, Paluska came to the door and we got in.

The Casino Ballroom has a policy that everyone must sit down at their table for all shows. And they enforce it with their steroid-crazed bouncers. You can hear them yelling for people to sit down early in the 1st set. More than 1 person got tossed out for standing/dancing. They had a small dance floor to the side of the stage. That was the only place were you could dance. The Casino Ballroom sucks. 

NO tracking/editing/alterations performed before archiving to 24-bit FLAC
(except to trim silence from the ends).

Seeded to FurthurNet (www.furthurnet.org)
